message: I learned a lot on interfacing compiled binaries with Python during the Scientific BOF at PyCon.  Although strongly buying in the advantages offered by ctypes, I am thinking about alternatives to my current approach to mixing-language.
There's also a related thread happening on numpy-discussion list http://www.mail-archive.com/numpy-discussion@scipy.org/msg30467.html
My question is, are there good resources on evaluation of different approaches available?
This paper has some direct comparison (despite the title it is not only about Cython): http://simula.no/research/sc/publications/Simula.SC.578
and here's a recent paper on Cython, although behind a paywallhttp://scitation.aip.org/getabs/servlet/GetabsServlet?prog=normal&id=CSENFA000013000002000031000001&idtype=cvips&gifs=yes
@dagss Thanks!  I did notice the Simula paper before but thought it's for Cython only :p
